meanings.definition: Of or relating to the calyx of a flower.
meanings.sent1: The calycinal petals of the rose were vibrant and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The calycinal part of the flower protected the delicate bud.
meanings.sent3: The calycinal calyx danced in the breeze, showing off its colors.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed around her like a calycinal embrace.
meanings.sent5: The calycinal shape of the flower made it easy to identify.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the calyx or cup-shaped structure of certain echinoderms.
meanings.sent1: The calycinal arms of the sea star helped it move gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The calycinal structure of the sea urchin provided protection.
meanings.sent3: The calycinal echinoderm waved its arms in a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: The calycinal shape of the creature resembled a delicate cup.
meanings.sent5: The calycinal design of the echinoderm was fascinating to observe.
